summary: When pirates threaten your existence, how far would you go to fight for what you believe? For those you care about? Monarchs...
caption:
When pirates threaten your existence, how far would you go to fight for what you believe? For those you care about? Monarchs take harsh measures to contain the advance of piracy. But the measure backfires. Now, royal families watch the gruesome consequences of the actions, drowning nations in panic. Who could be the next heir to disappear?

               An appless royals/pirates pairs smut rp (a little bit of everything)

home. ~ navi. ~ characters. ~ pairs. ~ taken fcs. ~ app.

blog.name: newyorkroleplay-archive
blog.title: NEW YORK CITY.
blog.description:
new york city comprises five boroughs sitting where the hudson river meets the atlantic ocean. at its core is manhattan, a densely populated borough that’s among the world’s major commercial, financial and cultural centres. its iconic sites include skyscrapers such as the empire state building and sprawling central park. broadway theatre is staged in neon-lit times square.
MOBILE.

summary: MADELINE ABELIN -- Birthdate: April 17th, 1991 ( 27 ) Gender and Pronouns: Female, she/her Hometown: New York, New York...
caption:
MADELINE ABELIN –

Birthdate: April 17th, 1991 ( 27 )
Gender and Pronouns: Female, she/her
Hometown: New York, New York
Neighborhood: Greenwich Village, Manhattan
Occupation: Investigative Journalist and True Crime Podcaster
Faceclaim: Brie Larson
Trigger Warnings: None.

BIOGRAPHY –

Madeline grew up incredibly wealthy. She has family on all corners of the world, but her father decided to move to Canada when he was in his mid twenties in order to expand his family’s legacy and start his own family with a healthy distance from the drama in France. Luckily, the move did wonders for him, and he was able to grow his wealth threefold, get married and have a beautiful daughter, Madeline. Madeline was everything her parents could’ve wanted. She was well behaved, calculating and clever. In fact, when the family moved to New York after their company’s expansion and the young girl had to say goodbye to her friends and everything she knew, she barely batted an eyelid. Like most challenges she’d faced at the ripe old age of six, she packed up her Hermes suitcase and tied her golden locks into a neat bun on the top of her head, ready to face whatever it was the world had in store for her. It wasn’t until she was fifteen when she found her true passion. One night, after the ninth episode of Law & Order, Madeline became curious. She pulled out her iBook and began researching. Though the information was quite scarce and often times, terrifying, Madeline was fascinated by True Crime. She read articles upon articles and visited the New York Public Library several times a week, nose buried in another crime fiction novel.

Though her mother wasn’t particularly pleased with her daughter’s unorthodox interests,  her father was impressed and encouraged her to take that spark and turn it into a full on raging fire. She knew she had two choices, become a detective, or talk about them. She chose the lazier route and studied her Masters in Journalism at Colombia. She now writes extensive pieces for a quarterly magazine and co hosts her very own True Crime podcast with a friend she met while studying. When she graduated from college, Madeline reluctantly moved out of her parent’s penthouse apartment in the Upper West Side and bought herself a property in Greenwich Village. Her place isn’t too big, but is pretty comfortable considering her age and occupation. She isn’t ashamed of coming from money, but doesn’t let it define her and though she often indulges in the finer things, she’s perfectly happy staying home with dominos pizza and Diet Coke. She has a great relationship with her parents, even though her mother won’t stop hounding her about getting married, but it’s as if she’s a completely different person when she isn’t around her friends and family from back home. With family and family friends, Madeline is graceful, charming and quite delightful. When she’s with her New York friends, or strangers however, she’s Lina. She’s carefree, stubborn, fiery and sarcastic. She smokes, drinks and swears like a sailor. She’s often on edge in public as she doesn’t want the two worlds to collide, though she knows it’s only a matter of time. Madeline grew up an only child, however her mother and father recently adopted the orphan son of good friends of theirs. The child is five years old and she adores him, and often babysits when she has a free evening just so that she can spend time with him.

PERSONALITY –

( + ) honest, generous, playful.
( - ) blunt, nonchalant, unpredictable.
